briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety of XP12B in Women With Menorrhagia

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Women with menorrhagia
* 18-49 years of age
* Regularly occurring menstrual periods

Exclusion Criteria:

* History or presence of clinically significant disease or abnormalities that may confound the study
* History of bilateral oophorectomy or hysterectomy
* Hormone therapy for birth control

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Reduction From Baseline in Menstrual Blood Loss (MBL)
outcomeMeasures.description: reduction of menstrual blood loss in mL

outcomeMeasures.title: Patient Reported Outcome Measure of Limitations in Social or Leisure Activities Associated With Heavy Menstrual Bleeding
outcomeMeasures.description: A positive unit change of the mean relects an improvement from baseline. Patient reported outcome scores had the following response categories: 1=not limited at all; 2=slightly limited; 3=moderately limited; 4=quite a bit limited; and 5=extremely limited

outcomeMeasures.title: Patient Reported Outome Measure of Limitations in Physical Activities Associated With Heavy Menstrual Bleeding
outcomeMeasures.description: A positive unit change of the mean relects an improvement from baseline. Patient reported outcome scores had the following response categories: 1=not limited at all; 2=slightly limited; 3=moderately limited; 4=quite a bit limited; and 5=extremely limited

outcomeMeasures.title: Responder Analysis - Reduction in Large Stains
outcomeMeasures.description: Percentage of subjects who experienced a reduction from baseline in the frequency of large stains
